alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Magoffin; Perry; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 12:03AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Gusty Showers will impact portions of Harlan, east central Bell, central Leslie, Letcher, Perry, Knott, central Floyd, southeastern Breathitt, western Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 1245 AM EDT... At 1202 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Elmrock to Big Laurel to near Sneedville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Handshoe, Bolyn, Vail, Mousie, Yellow Mountain, Elmrock, Soft Shell, Vest and Larkslane around 1210 AM EDT. Mid, Betty, Gunlock and Closplint around 1215 AM EDT. Estill, Wayland, Bosco, Delphia, Garret, Porter Junction, Hueysville, Gordon, Hippo and Hiram around 1220 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Benham, Langley, Eastern, Defeated Creek, Hunter, Banks, Drift, Minnie, Kingdom Come S.P., Hallie, Cumberland, Lynch, Martin, Printer, Skyline, Linefork, Alphoretta, Lilley Cornett Woods, Blue Moon, Blair, Letcher, Blackey, Dana, Kings Creek, Flint, Honaker, Aluba, Roxana, Premium, Maggard, Justell, Betsy Layne, Day, Dongola, Ice, Harold, Oscaloosa, Whitco, Trailer, Boldman, Pikeville, Whitesburg, Coal Run Village, Ermine, Colly, Marlowe, Bellcraft, Oven Fork, Eolia and Mayking. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Floyd; Harlan; Knott; Leslie; Letcher; Magoffin; Perry; Pike
